image.altText: David Pocock

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's 2023 promise to fix a "building with buckets to collect leaks" remains unfulfilled, according to the National Gallery of Australia's annual report.

title.children: Pocock slams government over leaky roof housing $5b national collection

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair wearing a black blazer stands in a conference room looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University's dire financial situation is "improving", and interim vice-chancellor Rebekah Brown says the university has now set a new target of delivering a surplus next year.

title.children: Rebekah Brown says ANU campus 'a lot calmer' since she came on board

image.altText: Black-and-white picture of Ben Aulich.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has found a Canberra woman was unfairly stripped of the value of her shares in two companies founded by former lawyer Ben Aulich, awarding her $500,000 in compensation.

title.children: Judge rules Canberra woman entitled to $500k after share dispute

image.altText: Chris Steel talking to media outdoors.

props.synopsis: Five days after being censured in the ACT's Legislative Assembly for the bungled rollout of the territory's MyWay+ network, Transport Minister Chris Steel has issued a statement to "apologise to anyone impacted by the transition to the new service".

title.children: Sorry seems to be the hardest word for Chris Steel

image.altText: A relaxed mother and her joey, in better times.

props.synopsis: Koala advocates and logging supporters have seized on the release of data showing koala population estimates tripled in the past three years.

title.children: Estimated koala numbers triple, but advocates dispute CSIRO's figures

image.altText: A boy does an activity at a table with his father.

props.synopsis: Liam used to dread walking through the school gates. Now, he can't wait to learn — but it took leaving a system that made him feel ignored to get there.

title.children: 'Terrible to watch': Why one family pulled their son from a Canberra public school

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Xiantao Shang went to an apartment seeking a woman who owed him money. When told she was not there, he and an accomplice forced their way in and assaulted the couple inside.

title.children: Canberra man avoids jail sentence over violent home invasion

image.altText: Disability car parks are behind fences with with no access signs on them.

props.synopsis: Patients with mobility issues are struggling to visit medical professionals after the Theatre Lane car park closed for the construction of the Lyric Theatre.

title.children: Disability parking closure leaves Canberra patients searching for options

image.altText: An older woman with short white hair sits in a living room looking serious.

props.synopsis: From today Canberrans like Gail Ford will be able to apply for the ACT's new voluntary assisted dying scheme, which its advocates say gives dignity in death to applicants.

title.children: ACT voluntary assisted dying scheme begins, allowing Canberrans to 'die with dignity'

image.altText: Ben Andersonn with a black tshirt and black cap pats his dog on while sitting in the frame of a tiny home.

props.synopsis: Public interest in tiny homes has skyrocketed in recent years, but experts warn they come with their own problems.

title.children: Are tiny homes the solution to Australia's housing crisis?

image.altText: A young girl in a school uniform poses in front of a garden

props.synopsis: Parents of students at a Sydney school where a five-year-old girl was hit by a car and killed last week have demanded action to prevent another tragedy.

title.children: 'I got scoffed at': Parents demand action after girl's death outside Sydney school

image.altText: A large group of kayakers on the water, looking on at a massive coal bulk carrier.

props.synopsis: A Hunter Valley businessman is demanding recompense after the cancellation of a second cruise liner's visit to Newcastle amid safety fears sparked by a planned climate change protest on the harbour.

title.children: Furious businessman demands compensation from climate activists

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they leave after a bilateral meeting in South Korea

props.synopsis: China has ended retaliatory tariffs on a range of US agricultural products but will maintain 10 per cent tariffs on all US goods in response to President Donald Trump's "Liberation Day" duties.

title.children: China lifts some tariffs on US farm goods but soybeans remain costly

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine turn around to look at Prince Andrew

props.synopsis: King Charles III's move to strip Andrew of all his titles and boot him out of his sprawling Windsor Park palace was a defining moment, but some say the former prince is getting off too lightly.

title.children: Andrew's exile isn't enough for some critics. Here's what could come next

image.altText: A thick plume of black smoke rising above an airplane

props.synopsis: A UPS cargo plane with three people on board crashes after exploding during take-off from Louisville International Airport in the US state of Kentucky.

title.children: At least seven dead after cargo plane crashes in Kentucky

image.altText: A woman in a red cap and white t-short with fake blood on her neck.

props.synopsis: The boss of the Perth Football League urges clubs to treat the suspension of Osborne Park FC over an end-of-season costume stunt as a "line in the sand moment" for their culture.

title.children: Football club fined for Charlie Kirk costume amid Osborne Park FC ban

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: Police are investigating damage to a communications tower in the NSW Hunter region after calls to triple-0 were impacted by an Optus outage.

title.children: Triple-0 calls hit by Optus mobile outage leaving 34,000 without service

image.altText: An Asian Giant Hornet wearing a tracking device

props.synopsis: An American teacher and his teenage son die after being stung more than 100 times by a swarm of hornets while climbing down a tree after zip-lining at a resort in Laos.

title.children: Father and son killed by 'murder hornets' during Laos holiday

image.altText: An aeroplane looks microscopic when silhouetted by a supermoon.

props.synopsis: The difference from other full moons won't be all that noticeable to the naked eye, but you can enhance the viewing experience if you pick the right time and vantage point.

title.children: The 'beaver' full moon will be the the closest supermoon of the year. Here's how to see it

image.altText: Jake Weatherald holds his helmet and bat in celebration

props.synopsis: Australia has named its squad for the first Ashes Test, but is no closer to knowing who will open the batting in Perth on November 21.

title.children: Australia keeps opening mystery alive with 15-man Ashes squad

image.altText: Josh Giddey throws a left-handed pass past Joel Embiid.

props.synopsis: Australia's Josh Giddey becomes the first Bulls player to record back-to-back triple doubles since Michael Jordan in 1989 as the Bulls continue their fast start to the NBA season.

title.children: Giddey joins Jordan in recording 36-year first in epic Bulls comeback

image.altText: A penguin flaps its wings on the sand at Gabo Island

props.synopsis: A re-establishing little penguin colony, once locally extinct, is finding its feet on the NSW far south coast.

title.children: World's smallest penguins return to coastal hamlet after 30-year disappearance

image.altText: Danielle North

props.synopsis: Executive director Danielle North has departed Ambulance Victoria, after the service said she may have misled a parliamentary committee about her knowledge of gatherings during COVID lockdowns.

title.children: Executive director leaves Ambulance Victoria after parliamentary inquiry

image.altText: An older man under a pop up gazebo with a trailer full of mandarins

props.synopsis: Raymond Aitkin has been selling seasonal fruit by the side of the road for more than 20 years, but he has found himself before the court twice this year and claims the council is singling him out.

title.children: Pensioner vows to 'keep breaking the law' with roadside produce stand

image.altText: two players, Callum Ah Chee and Lachie Neale hug on the footy field after a winning goal..

props.synopsis: Australia's race discrimination commissioner says the AFL is falling far short of its responsibility to combat "horrific racism" aimed at its players.

title.children: 'You're nowhere near': Scathing message for AFL CEO on racism

image.altText: A weather radar being displayed on a phone, in front of a different radar on a computer screen

props.synopsis: Tender documents and sources show the Bureau of Meteorology's new website may have cost between $78m and $150m — much higher than initially reported.

title.children: BOM website questions intensify over true cost of redesign

image.altText: Two people on a motion-blurred city street with a temple and spire. Overlay "Race Around the World"

props.synopsis: Cult '90s show Race Around the World is back, and we're on the hunt for fearless storytellers! Got a passport, an epic sense of adventure and an eye for a story? We want to hear from you.

title.children: This career-making travel show is making a comeback and casting is open

image.altText: Stacey Jones directs a New Zealand training session

props.synopsis: New Zealand coach Stacey Jones says his thoughts are with Eliesa Katoa as he prepares his side to take on Samoa in the final of the Pacific Championships.

title.children: Kiwis coach calls for greater scrutiny of warm-ups after Katoa incident

image.altText: An older man sits in a hospital bed with a tube in his nose.

props.synopsis: Families and insiders say the system to assess people for aged care is in crisis, with 116,000 people on the waiting list. Once approved, they join the queue to get a home care package, which stands at more than 120,000.

title.children: Older Australians must now queue to join the queue for home care

image.altText: Generic image of a phone displaying a folder of social media apps.

props.synopsis: Nine platform are included in Australia's world-first social media ban for under 16s next month, however the regulator warns that list could grow.

title.children: Which social media apps will ban Australian users under-16?

image.altText: A crashed car outside a hospital

props.synopsis: NSW Ambulance paramedics treated a 47-year-old man and a 24-year-old woman, who are Concord Hospital employees.

title.children: Workers fight for life after car runs them down outside Sydney hospital

image.altText: Sophie McKay of the Blues with father, Andrew McKay during the 2025 AFLW Round 01 match.

props.synopsis: Despite coming from a family with a strong pedigree for football, one of the AFLW's best new talents almost gave it up. Now, she is enjoying putting on a show.

title.children: Sophie comes from a famous football family. Yet she almost didn't play

image.altText: Graphic with a lightbulb, logo of Temu, Commbank and HCF on a dynamic blue background.

props.synopsis: Five companies have been handed the infamous annual award by consumer group Choice, in a bid to name and shame "dodgy products, services and companies".

title.children: The five 'shonkiest' products and companies named at Choice awards

image.altText: A group of police crowd around a white ute which has slammed into a wall in a food court.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police says a woman has been seriously injured after a car crashed into a food court in Launceston's CBD.

title.children: Woman seriously injured after car ploughs into Launceston food court

image.altText: A dead fish with a gaping mouth

props.synopsis: Scientists believe they have identified the species responsible for the toxins in South Australia's marine algal bloom that has killed millions of aquatic animals.

title.children: Scientists hopeful they have found source of SA algal bloom toxins
